H0.text: Its height increases when the velocity of an ocean wave decreases as it approaches a shore.

H1.text: Its height decreases when the velocity of an ocean wave decreases as it approaches a shore.

H2.text: Its length shortens when the velocity of an ocean wave decreases as it approaches a shore.

H3.text: It crests when the velocity of an ocean wave decreases as it approaches a shore.

A4.text: As waves enter shallower waters, the decrease in group velocity caused by the reduction in water depth leads to a reduction in wave length and an increase in wave height.

A5.text: Shoaling waves will also exhibit a reduction in wavelength while the frequency remains constant.

A6.text: As the water depth decreases towards the coast, wave height increases due to wave shoaling and refraction.

A7.text: Therefore, the wave energy between rays is concentrated as they converge, with a resulting increase in wave height.
